intro: Draba schultzei, commonly known as the Schultze's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many mustard species, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, yellow or white flowers that attract pollinators. Draba schultzei is often found in high-altitude environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
